title: The bond market doesn't believe the Fed cut was one-and-done, says strategist
text: U.S. Treasurys are signaling a lack of faith in the idea that the Fed's first rate cut in a decade isn't the start of a pattern, says Bank of America Merrill Lynch's Paul Ciana.

title: The Week in Business: The China Trade War Clobbers the Markets
text: Plus, where should police departments draw the line with facial recognition surveillance?

title: Trump: things 'going along very well' with China as markets fall over tariffs
text: Donald Trump has said things are “going along very well” with China, a day after financial markets around the world fell sharply following the president’s threat to impose a new tariff on $300bn (£248bn) of Chinese goods, in a rapid escalation of the trade war between Washington and Beijing.

title: Trump defends stance on China trade after new tariffs
text: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday that things are going well with China, insisting U.S. consumers are not paying for import taxes he has imposed on goods from that country although economists say Americans are footing the bill.

title: Traders are betting big on a sudden drop in stocks and it's starting to pay off
text: Traders have been loading up on call options in the Cboe Volatility Index, AKA the VIX or "fear gauge," wagering on big price swings in the market.

title: Jeff Bezos touts a full-power firing of Blue Origin’s next-generation BE-4 rocket engine
text: Amazon billionaire Jeff Bezos is showing off a picture of his Blue Origin space venture’s BE-4 rocket engine going full blast during a hot-fire test in Texas.
